item.title: Nodejs Install E401
item.description: Today I created a simple nodeJS Azure Functions Applicaiton to start building out a PoC and when I tried to install it’s dependencies like so: npm install I got this little cherub back instead: npm ERR! code E401 npm ERR! Incorrect or missing password. npm ERR! If you were trying to login, change your password, create an npm ERR! authentication token or enable two-factor authentication then npm ERR! that means you likely typed your password in incorrectly.

item.title: Modern-ish Javascript
item.description: This post includes a few notes on ECMA language features that I like as well as some info on memory leaking. I have no doubt that it will read disjointed; I started this eons ago and only now have I decided to publish it. A simple reminder of what Node.js is …it is a set of APIs wrapped around the V8 Engine (written in c++) and is a high-performance JavaScript and WebAssembly engine.
